subject: Re: [junit] How to test continuous changing return value?
msgSnippet: You could make it so your data is also part of your test environment and set the primary key in the persistant store to a known value. Of course no one else
messageBody:
You could make it so your data is also part of your test environment and set
the primary key in the persistant store to a known value. Of course no one
else can be running a similar test (ie that uses the entity pk) at the same
time, and you have to tear down the generated data before this test case can be
executed again, and probably set the pk back to its original value ??


On Wed, 17 Jan
2001, you wrote: > hi all.I have a question in using junit ,can you help me ? >
> say I have a class, PKGenerator,used to make primarykey for another > entity
class.see codes below: >
> classs PKGenerator {
> public int getPK(String EntityName){
> int Result;
> / / load pk from some persistence,such as database
> Result=loadPK(EntityName);
> Result++;
> / / write it back
> savePK(Result);
> return Result;
> }
> .....................................
> }}
> public class someEntity{
> String thisName;
> int PK;
> String someValue;
> public saveEntity{
> PKGenerator PKGen=new PKGenerator();
> PK=PKGen.getPK(thisName);
> save(thisName,PK,someValue);
> }
> ............................
> }
>
>
> /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
> int PKGenerator.getPK(String EntityName) method will always return
> the highest PK value from some persistence,
> so how should I write a testXXX that can always work?
>
> I searched the document but didn't get answer,any help will be
> appreciated.
>
